intro: Sphaeradenia sanctae-barbarae subsp. sanctae-barbarae, commonly known as the sacred mountain hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and pink. The plant is evergreen, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
